xs.description: Shadows allow you to add depth and realism to designs by positioning elements on a z-axis.

xs-skeuomorphic.description:
Used to create a subtle skeuomorphic effect in components such as buttons and tabs.

This can be removed or replaced with shadow-xs if you prefer a flat style.

standard.description: Used for focus states in components. For example toggles and checkboxes.

xs.description: Used for focus states in components that also require a shadow. For example, buttons and tabs.

xs-skeuomorphic.description:
Used for focus states in components that also require a shadow and a subtle skeuomorphic effect. For example, buttons and tabs.

This can be replaced with focus-ring-shadow-xs if you prefer a flat style.

sm.description: Used for focus states in components that also require a shadow. For example, buttons and tabs.

error.description: Used for destructive or error focus states in components. For example, destructive button links.

error-xs.description: Used for destructive or error focus states in components that also require a shadow. For example, destructive buttons.

error-xs-skeuomorphic.description:
Used for focus states in destructive or error components that also require a shadow and a subtle skeuomorphic effect. For example, destructive buttons.

This can be replaced with focus-ring-error-shadow-xs if you prefer a flat style.
